channel.title: technology on Eureka!
channel.description: Recent content in technology on Eureka!

item.title: The ~~Masochist~~ Amazing World of Compilers
item.description: Introduction It’s All Binaries Automatons Roll Out Compiling Flexing my Bison with a Calculator 1.Introduction When we think of computers, particularly programming languages, one of the first questions that should come to mind is, “How does the computer understand that?“And that is one of the questions that can be answered by analyzing how a compiler works. Compilers are basically programs that can translate programming languages into computer language. And that is what we are going to talk about in this article.

item.title: Generating Random Passwords
item.description: Generating Random Passwords Introduction Why Computers can’t Generate Random Numbers? /dev/urandom and /dev/random Implementing a CLI on Linux 1.Introduction I have been taking some classes at the university these last few weeks, and we started to get a grasp on the C programming language, and I really like the idea of seeing how things work under the hood. But I really think that the best way to see if you are really getting somewhere is to make some projects, and one of the things that I consider very useful but we don’t have that by default on Linux is a random password generator, so I decided to create a simple CLI program that does exactly that generates random passwords.

item.title: 2fa Authentication PHP
item.description: Introduction What is the OTP? URI Format Enconding with Base32 Generating a QRCode 1.Introduction For the last month, I have been working on a library for PHP that will implement the OTP(One Time Password) in an easy way. In the following topics, I will try to explain each technology and protocol that were used to build this software. If you don’t want to pass for this technical stuff, you can just go to the explanation of the library.
